qas.question: What percentage of the population speaks Portuguese?
What percentage of the population speaks Crioulo?
What are the two main religions?
What is their gross domestic product status?

answers.text: one of the lowest in the world

context: Only <a0_0>14%<a0_0/> of the population speaks Portuguese, established as the official language in the colonial period. Almost half the population (<a1_0>44%<a1_0/>) speaks Crioulo, a Portuguese-based creole language, and the remainder speak a variety of native African languages. The main religions are <a2_0>African traditional religions and Islam<a2_0/>; there is a <a4_0>Christian (mostly Roman Catholic)<a4_0/> minority. The country's per-capita gross domestic product is <a3_0>one of the lowest in the world<a3_0/>.
